COMMAND.name: show ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the global information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command displays the global information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
The following example shows the global state of PTP: Switch# show ptp -------------------------- Global Configure -------------------------- PTP State : disable Port Number : 0 Domain : 0 Slave Only : false Clock Type : ordinary clock Clock Step : two-step Priority1 : 128 Priority2 : 128 Clock Accuracy : 0xfe Clock Class : 248 Time Source : internal-oscillator(160) UTC Offset : 0 Leap59 : false Leap61 : false Local Clock Identity : 82:10:71:FF:FE:98:DA:00 Set systime via PTP : false
--------------------------- BMC Properties --------------------------- Receive Member : N/A Parent Clock Identity : N/A Parent Port Number : 0 Mean Path Delay : 0 Offset From Master : 0 Step Removed : 0 GM Clock Identity : N/A GM Priority1 : 0 GM Priority2 : 0 GM Clock Accuracy : 0xfe GM Clock Class : 248 GM Time Source : internal-oscillator(160) GM UTC Offset : 0 GM UTC Offset Valid : false GM Time Scale : ARB GM Time Traceable : false GM Leap59 : false GM Leap61 : false GM Frequency Traceable : false

COMMAND.name: show ptp brief
COMMAND.help: The brief precision time protocol information
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the global brief information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command displays the global brief information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows the brief global state of PTP: Switch# show ptp brief -------------------------- Global Configure -------------------------- PTP State : disable Port Number : 0 Domain : 0 Slave Only : false Clock Type : ordinary clock Priority1 : 128 Priority2 : 128 Clock Accuracy : 0xfe Clock Class : 248 Time Source : internal-oscillator(160) UTC Offset : 34 Leap59 : false Leap61 : false Local Clock Identity : 82:10:71:FF:FE:98:DA:00 Set systime via PTP: : false

COMMAND.name: show ptp foreign-master
COMMAND.help: The foreign master information
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the foreign-master information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command displays the foreign-master information of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows the foreign-master information of PTP: Switch# show ptp foreign-master Foreign_master_port_identity Qualification Interface ---------------------------------+--------------+----------------------- *82:10:71:FF:FE:98:DA:00@9 true eth-0-9

COMMAND.name: show ptp interface
COMMAND.help: Interface information

PARAM.name: if_name
PARAM.help: Ethernet interface name

PARAM.name: brief
PARAM.help: The brief precision time protocol information

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: This command can display the ptp configuration and statistics on interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The interface only can be agg port and physical port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example display how to show the interface eth-0-9 ptp brief information: Switch# show ptp interface eth-0-9 brief Name State Delay-mechanism Enable Step ---------------+---------------+---------------+---------------+-------- eth-0-9 slave normal enable two

COMMAND.name: show ptp statistics
COMMAND.help: Packet statistics information

PARAM.name: if_name
PARAM.help: Ethernet interface name

PARAM.name: receive
PARAM.help: Packet receive

PARAM.name: send
PARAM.help: Packet send

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: Packet discard

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ ${part} == "all" ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/ptp/show_ptp/statistics else if [ ${pkt_type} == "all" ]; then cdbctl show/cdb/ptp/show_ptp/statistics/${if_name} else cdbctl show/cdb/ptp/show_ptp/statistics/${if_name}/${pkt_type} fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: This command can display the ptp statistics on interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The interface only can agg port and physical port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example display how to show the interface eth-0-9 ptp statistics: Switch# show ptp statistics eth-0-9 ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Interface : eth-0-9 --------------------------- Port Statistic --------------------------- Recv Packet Statistics ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Announce : 172 Sync : 333 Delay_Req : 0 Pdelay_Req : 0 Delay_Resp : 227 Pdelay_Resp : 0 Follow_Up : 333 Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up : 0 Unknown : 0 Send Packet Statistics ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Announce : 0 Sync : 1 Delay_Req : 227 Pdelay_Req : 0 Delay_Resp : 0 Pdelay_Resp : 0 Follow_Up : 1 Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up : 0 Unknown : 0 Discard Packet Statistics ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Announce : 0 Sync : 10 Delay_Req : 0 Pdelay_Req : 0 Delay_Resp : 0 Pdelay_Resp : 0 Follow_Up : 10 Pdelay_Resp_Follow_Up : 0 Unknown : 0

COMMAND.name: show ptp second
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: This command can display the ptp time information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example display how to show ptp time information: Switch# show ptp second PTP SECOND: 1479824238 UTC DATE :Tue Nov 22 14:16:44 2016 TOW: 1924, SOW : 224219

COMMAND.name: clear ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

COMMAND.name: clear ptp statistics
COMMAND.help: Clear statistics

PARAM.name: if_name
PARAM.help: Ethernet interface name

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ ${part} == "all" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/clear_ptp/statistics else cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/clear_ptp/statistics/${if_name} fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use clear ptp statistics command to delete all statistics of PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example display how to delete all statistics of ptp: Switch# clear ptp statistics

COMMAND.name: debug ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

PARAM.name: communication
PARAM.help: PTP communication

PARAM.name: bmc
PARAM.help: PTP bmc

PARAM.name: timer
PARAM.help: PTP timer

PARAM.name: synchronization
PARAM.help: PTP synchronization

PARAM.name: packet
PARAM.help: PTP packet

PARAM.name: rx
PARAM.help: PTP receive packets

PARAM.name: tx
PARAM.help: PTP send packets

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: PTP discard packets

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "all" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_communication_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_bmc_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_timer_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_synchronization_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_rx_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_tx_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_discard_debug/1 elif [ "communication" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_communication_debug/1 elif [ "bmc" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_bmc_debug/1 elif [ "timer" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_timer_debug/1 elif [ "synchronization" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_synchronization_debug/1 else if [ "all" == ${pkt} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_rx_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_tx_debug/1 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_discard_debug/1 else cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_${type}_${pkt}_debug/1 fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable debugging ptp.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: In the following example shows how to enable debugging ptp all: Switch# debug ptp all

COMMAND.name: no debug ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

PARAM.name: communication
PARAM.help: PTP communication

PARAM.name: bmc
PARAM.help: PTP bmc

PARAM.name: timer
PARAM.help: PTP timer

PARAM.name: synchronization
PARAM.help: PTP synchronization

PARAM.name: packet
PARAM.help: PTP packet

PARAM.name: rx
PARAM.help: PTP receive packets

PARAM.name: tx
PARAM.help: PTP send packets

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: PTP discard packets

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "all" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_communication_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_bmc_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_timer_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_synchronization_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_rx_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_tx_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_discard_debug/0 elif [ "communication" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_communication_debug/0 elif [ "bmc" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_bmc_debug/0 elif [ "timer" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_timer_debug/0 elif [ "synchronization" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_synchronization_debug/0 else if [ "all" == ${pkt} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_rx_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_tx_debug/0 cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_packet_discard_debug/0 else cdbctl update/cdb/debug/ptp_debug/ptp_${type}_${pkt}_debug/0 fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable debugging ptp.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: In the following example shows how to disable debugging ptp all: Switch# no debug ptp all

COMMAND.name: show debugging ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

PARAM.name: detail
PARAM.help: Detail of debug module

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To display the debugging status, use the show debugging command in EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to display the debugging status.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following is sample output from the show debugging command: DUT1# show debugging stp Module SubModule Type Status ------------+----------------+--------------------+------ switch stp event on stp packet tx on stp packet rx on stp proto cist on stp proto msti on stp timer on

COMMAND.name: ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

COMMAND.name: ptp clock-step
COMMAND.help: The step mode of the clock

PARAM.name: one-step
PARAM.help: Change to one-step clock

PARAM.name: two-step
PARAM.help: Change to two-step clock (default)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-step mode to one-step or two-step.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the clock mode is two-step.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock mode to one-step: Switch(config)# ptp clock-step one-step

COMMAND.name: no ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

COMMAND.name: no ptp clock-step
COMMAND.help: The step mode of the clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-step mode to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the clock mode is two-step.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock-step mode to default: Switch(config)# no ptp clock-step

COMMAND.name: ptp device-type
COMMAND.help: The type of the clock

PARAM.name: bc
PARAM.help: Boundary Clock

PARAM.name: oc
PARAM.help: Ordinary Clock (default)

PARAM.name: e2etc
PARAM.help: End-to-End Transparent Clock

PARAM.name: p2ptc
PARAM.help: Peer-to-Peer Transparent Clock

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock type.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the device type is ordinary clock.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock type to boundary clock: Switch(config)# ptp device-type bc

COMMAND.name: no ptp device-type
COMMAND.help: The type of the clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command can set the clock type to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the device type is ordinary clock.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock type to default: Switch(config)# no ptp device-type

COMMAND.name: ptp global-enable
COMMAND.help: Enable ptp globally
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock enable globally.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, PTP is disabled on device.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock enable PTP: Switch(config)# ptp global-enable

COMMAND.name: no ptp global-enable
COMMAND.help: Enable ptp globally
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock disable globally.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, PTP is disabled on device.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock disable PTP: Switch(config)# no ptp global-enable

COMMAND.name: ptp domain
COMMAND.help: The domain attribute of the local clock

PARAM.name: domain_id
PARAM.help: The value of domain, default is 0

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the domain of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the domain to 1: Switch(config)# ptp domain 1

COMMAND.name: no ptp domain
COMMAND.help: The domain attribute of the local clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the domain of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the domain to default: Switch(config)# no ptp domain

COMMAND.name: ptp slave-only
COMMAND.help: Slave-only clock can never enter the MASTER state
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the ordinary clock to slave-only.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command can only be used on OC mode. By default, the clock is not slave-only.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock slave-only: Switch(config)# ptp slave-only

COMMAND.name: no ptp slave-only
COMMAND.help: Slave-only clock can never enter the MASTER state
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the ordinary clock to not slave-only.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command can only be used on OC mode. By default, the clock is not slave-only.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock not slave-only: Switch(config)# no ptp slave-only

COMMAND.name: ptp utc-offset
COMMAND.help: The offset between TAI and UTC

PARAM.name: utc_offset
PARAM.help: The value of utc-offset, default is 0s

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set utc-offset.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: N/A.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the utc-offset to 20: Switch(config)# ptp utc-offset 20

COMMAND.name: no ptp utc-offset
COMMAND.help: The offset between TAI and UTC
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set utc-offset to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: N/A.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the utc-offset to default: Switch(config)# no ptp utc-offset

COMMAND.name: ptp set-systime
COMMAND.help: Set system time via PTP
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enale system set time from PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: N/A.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set system time via PTP: Switch(config)# ptp set-systime

COMMAND.name: no ptp set-systime
COMMAND.help: Set system time via PTP
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disale system set time from PTP.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: N/A.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set system time not via PTP: Switch(config)# no ptp set-systime

COMMAND.name: ptp leap59
COMMAND.help: The last minute of the current UTC day contains 59 seconds
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the leap59 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, leap59 is not configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the leap59: Switch(config)# ptp leap59

COMMAND.name: no ptp leap59
COMMAND.help: The last minute of the current UTC day contains 59 seconds
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to unset the leap59 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, leap59 is not configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example unset the leap59: Switch(config)# no ptp leap59

COMMAND.name: ptp leap61
COMMAND.help: The last minute of the current UTC day contains 61 seconds
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the leap61 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, leap61 is not configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the leap61: Switch(config)# ptp leap61

COMMAND.name: no ptp leap61
COMMAND.help: The last minute of the current UTC day contains 61 seconds
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to unset the leap61 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, leap61 is not configured.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example unset the leap61: Switch(config)# no ptp leap61

COMMAND.name: ptp tc-primary-domain
COMMAND.help: The primary syntonization domain

PARAM.name: domain_id
PARAM.help: The value of tc-primary-domain, default is 0

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the primary domain of the transparent clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the primary domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the tc-primary-domain to 1: Switch(config)# ptp tc-primary-domain 1

COMMAND.name: no ptp tc-primary-domain
COMMAND.help: The primary syntonization domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the primary domain of the transparent clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the primary domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the tc-primary-domain to default: Switch(config)# no ptp tc-primary-domain

COMMAND.name: ptp priority1
COMMAND.help: The priority1 attribute of the local clock

PARAM.name: priority_id
PARAM.help: The value of priority1, default is 128

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the priority1 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the priority1 is 128.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the priority1 to 0: Switch(config)# ptp priority1 0

COMMAND.name: no ptp priority1
COMMAND.help: The priority1 attribute of the local clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the priority1 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the priority1 is 128.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the priority1 to default: Switch(config)# no ptp priority1

COMMAND.name: ptp priority2
COMMAND.help: The priority2 attribute of the local clock

PARAM.name: priority_id
PARAM.help: The value of priority2, default is 128

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the priority2 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the priority2 is 128.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the priority2 to 0: Switch(config)# ptp priority2 0

COMMAND.name: no ptp priority2
COMMAND.help: The priority2 attribute of the local clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the priority2 of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the priority2 is 128.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the priority2 to default: Switch(config)# no ptp priority2

COMMAND.name: ptp time-source
COMMAND.help: The source of time used by the local clock

PARAM.name: atomic-clock
PARAM.help: Device based on atomic resonance

PARAM.name: gps
PARAM.help: Device synchronized to a satellite system

PARAM.name: terrestrial-radio
PARAM.help: Device synchronized via radio distribution systems

PARAM.name: ptp
PARAM.help: Device synchronized to a PTP-based source

PARAM.name: ntp
PARAM.help: Device synchronized via NTP or SNTP to servers

PARAM.name: hand-set
PARAM.help: Device time has been set by human

PARAM.name: other
PARAM.help: Other source of time and/or frequency

PARAM.name: internal-oscillator
PARAM.help: Device time based on a free-running oscillator(default)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the time-source of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the time-source is internal-oscillator.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the time-source to gps: Switch(config)# ptp time-source gps

COMMAND.name: no ptp time-source
COMMAND.help: The source of time used by the local clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the time-source of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the time-source is internal-oscillator.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the time-source to default: Switch(config)# no ptp time-source

COMMAND.name: ptp clock-accuracy
COMMAND.help: The clock accuracy of the clock

PARAM.name: 0x20
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 25 ns

PARAM.name: 0x21
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 100 ns

PARAM.name: 0x22
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 250 ns

PARAM.name: 0x23
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 1 us

PARAM.name: 0x24
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 2.5 us

PARAM.name: 0x25
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 10 us

PARAM.name: 0x26
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 25 us

PARAM.name: 0x27
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 100 us

PARAM.name: 0x28
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 250 us

PARAM.name: 0x29
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 1 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2a
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 2.5 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2b
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 10 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2c
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 25 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2d
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 100 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2e
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 250 ms

PARAM.name: 0x2f
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 1 s

PARAM.name: 0x30
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to within 10 s

PARAM.name: 0x31
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to > 10 s

PARAM.name: 0xfe
PARAM.help: The time is accurate to unknown (default)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-accuracy of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the clock-accuracy is 0xfe.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock-accuracy to 0x21: Switch(config)# ptp clock-accuracy 0x21

COMMAND.name: no ptp clock-accuracy
COMMAND.help: The clock accuracy of the clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-accuracy of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the clock-accuracy is 0xfe.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock-accuracy to default: Switch(config)# no ptp clock-accuracy

COMMAND.name: ptp clock-class
COMMAND.help: The clock class attribute of an ordinary or boundary clock

PARAM.help: Synchronized to a primary reference time source
Previous designated as 6 but lost ability to synchronize to time source
Synchronized to an application-specific source of time
Previous designated as 13 but lost ability to synchronize to time source
Degradation alternative A for a clock of 7
Degradation alternative A for a clock of 14
Degradation alternative B for a clock of 7
Degradation alternative B for a clock of 14
None of the other clock class definitions apply (default)

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-class of the ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the clock class is 248.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock class to 6: Switch(config)# ptp clock-class 6

COMMAND.name: no ptp clock-class
COMMAND.help: The clock class attribute of an ordinary or boundary clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the clock-class of the ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of the clock class is 248.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the clock class to default: Switch(config)# no ptp clock-class

COMMAND.name: ptp clock-id
COMMAND.help: Set ptp clock id

PARAM.name: clock_id
PARAM.help: Clock id address, format is XXXX.XXXX.XXXX.XXXX

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the device clock id globally.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The clock id can label unique sequence number of the device. All "0" or all "F" are invalid.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Default clock id is route-mac + FFFE.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The follow example shows how to set device clock id: Switch(config)# ptp clock-id 0000.0000.0000.0001

COMMAND.name: no ptp clock-id
COMMAND.help: Set ptp clock id
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the device clock id to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The clock id can label unique sequence number of the device. All "0" or all "F" are invalid.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Default clock id is route-mac + FFFE.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The follow example shows how to set device clock id to default: Switch(config)# no ptp clock-id

COMMAND.name: ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

COMMAND.name: no ptp
COMMAND.help: Precision Time Protocol (IEEE1588)

COMMAND.name: ptp announce-interval
COMMAND.help: The mean announce interval

PARAM.name: interval
PARAM.help: The logarithm to the base 2 of the interval, default is 1

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the announce interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of announce interval is 1, that is, 2 seconds.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the announce interval of the interface to 10: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp announce-interval 10

COMMAND.name: no ptp announce-interval
COMMAND.help: The mean announce interval
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the announce interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of announce interval is 1, that is, 2 seconds.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the announce interval of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp announce-interval

COMMAND.name: ptp sync-interval
COMMAND.help: The mean sync interval for messages

PARAM.name: interval
PARAM.help: The logarithm to the base 2 of the interval, default is 0

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the sync interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of sync interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the sync interval of the interface to 10: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp sync-interval 10

COMMAND.name: no ptp sync-interval
COMMAND.help: The mean sync interval for messages
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the sync interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of sync interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the sync interval of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp sync-interval

COMMAND.name: ptp min-delayreq-interval
COMMAND.help: The minimum delay request interval for messages

PARAM.name: interval
PARAM.help: The logarithm to the base 2 of the interval, default is 0

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the min-delayreq interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of min-delayreq interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the min-delayreq interval of the interface to 10: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp min-delayreq-interval 10

COMMAND.name: no ptp min-delayreq-interval
COMMAND.help: The minimum delay request interval for messages
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the min-delayreq interval of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of min-delayreq interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the min-delayreq interval of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp min-delayreq-interval

COMMAND.name: ptp min-pdelayreq-interval
COMMAND.help: The minimum peer delay request interval for messages

PARAM.name: interval
PARAM.help: The logarithm to the base 2 of the interval, default is 0

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the min- pdelayreq interval of the interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of pdelayreq interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the min-pdelayreq interval of the interface to 10: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp min-pdelayreq-interval 10

COMMAND.name: no ptp min-pdelayreq-interval
COMMAND.help: The minimum peer delay request interval for messages
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the min- pdelayreq interval of the interface on clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of pdelayreq interval is 0, that is, 1 second.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the min-pdelayreq interval of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp min-pdelayreq-interval

COMMAND.name: ptp announce-receipt-timeout
COMMAND.help: The announce receipt timeout

PARAM.name: timeout
PARAM.help: The value of announce-receipt-timeout, default is 3

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the announce-receipt-timeout times of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of announce-receipt-timeout is 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the announce-receipt-timeout times of the interface to 3: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp announce-receipt-timeout 3

COMMAND.name: no ptp announce-receipt-timeout
COMMAND.help: The announce receipt timeout
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the announce-receipt-timeout times of the interface on ordinary clock or boundary clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of announce-receipt-timeout is 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the announce-receipt-timeout times of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp announce-receipt-timeout

COMMAND.name: ptp asymmetry-correction
COMMAND.help: The asymmetry correction of the path

PARAM.name: asymmetry-correction
PARAM.help: The value of asymmetry correction, default is 0ns

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the asymmetry-correction of the interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of asymmetry correction is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the asymmetry correction of the interface to 200: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp asymmetry-correction 200

COMMAND.name: no ptp asymmetry-correction
COMMAND.help: The asymmetry correction of the path
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the asymmetry-correction of the interface on clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of asymmetry correction is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the asymmetry correction of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp asymmetry-correction

COMMAND.name: ptp ingress-latency
COMMAND.help: Ingress latency

PARAM.name: latency
PARAM.help: The value of ingress latency, default is 0ns

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the ingress-latency.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of latency is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the ingress-latency of the interface to 200: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp ingress-latency 200

COMMAND.name: no ptp ingress-latency
COMMAND.help: Ingress latency
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the ingress-latency to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of latency is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the ingress-latency of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp ingress-latency

COMMAND.name: ptp egress-latency
COMMAND.help: Egress latency

PARAM.name: latency
PARAM.help: The value of egress latency, default is 0ns

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the egress-latency.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of latency is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the egress-latency of the interface to 200: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp egress-latency 200

COMMAND.name: no ptp egress-latency
COMMAND.help: Egress latency
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the egress-latency to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of latency is 0 nanosecond.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the egress-latency of the interface to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp egress-latency

COMMAND.name: ptp delay-mechanism
COMMAND.help: The propagation delay measuring option

PARAM.name: disable
PARAM.help: Do not implement the delay mechanism

PARAM.name: normal
PARAM.help: Use the delay request-response mechanism (default)

PARAM.name: peer
PARAM.help: Use the peer delay mechanism

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the delay mechanism of the interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of delay mechanism is normal.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the delay mechanism of the interface on clock to peer: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp delay-mechanism peer

COMMAND.name: no ptp delay-mechanism
COMMAND.help: The propagation delay measuring option
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the delay mechanism of the interface on clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, the value of delay mechanism is normal.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the delay mechanism of the interface on clock to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp delay-mechanism

COMMAND.name: ptp enable
COMMAND.help: Enable ptp on interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set PTP enable on the interface of clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, PTP is disabled on interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface enable PTP. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp enable

COMMAND.name: no ptp enable
COMMAND.help: Enable ptp on interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set PTP disable on the interface of clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, PTP is disabled on interface.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface disable PTP. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp enable

COMMAND.name: ptp tagging
COMMAND.help: Insert vlan tag in PTP messages

COMMAND.name: ptp tagging vlan

PARAM.name: vlan_id
PARAM.help: VLAN ID

PARAM.name: cos
PARAM.help: Class of Services

PARAM.name: cos_value
PARAM.help: The value of Class of Services

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the vlan of interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, there is no vlan tag in PTP message.If configure vlan tag without cos, the cos value will be 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface use vlan 2 and priority 3. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp tagging vlan 2 cos 3

COMMAND.name: no ptp tagging
COMMAND.help: Insert vlan tag in PTP messages

PARAM.name: cos
PARAM.help: Class of Services

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ ${part} == "vlan" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/ptp_port/${iface}/vlan_info/4096 else cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/ptp_port/${iface}/vlan_info/0/cos/8 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to unset the vlan of interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, there is no vlan tag in PTP message.If configure vlan tag without cos, the cos value will be 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface not use vlan tag. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp tagging vlan

COMMAND.name: ptp protocol
COMMAND.help: The protocol that PTP message transport over

PARAM.name: mac
PARAM.help: Transport PTP messages directly over Ethernet frames (default)

PARAM.name: udp
PARAM.help: Transport PTP messages over the UDP, and IPv4

PARAM.name: source-ip
PARAM.help: Source IPv4 address

PARAM.name: udp_source_ip
PARAM.help: IPv4 address

PARAM.name: dest-ip
PARAM.help: Dest Ipv4 address

PARAM.name: unicast_dest_ip
PARAM.help: Ipv4 address

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the protocol type of interface on clock.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, each interface is over ethernet protocol with multicast MAC address specified by IEEE Std 1588-2008. Only set udp source-ip A.B.C.D the ptp packet use l3 multicast. If set unicast dest-ip, the ptp packet use l3 unicast.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface use UDP protocol with source-ip 1.10.10.10. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# ptp protocol udp source-ip 1.10.10.10

COMMAND.name: no ptp protocol
COMMAND.help: The protocol that PTP message transport over
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ ${part} == "all" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/ptp_port/${iface}/port_addr/protocol/mac else cdbctl update/cdb/ptp/ptp_port/${iface}/port_addr/protocol/udp/unicast_dest_ip/0 fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the protocol type of interface on clock to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: By default, each interface is over ethernet protocol with multicast MAC address specified by IEEE Std 1588-2008. Only set udp source-ip A.B.C.D the ptp packet use l3 multicast. If set unicast dest-ip, the ptp packet use l3 unicast.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example set the interface use default encap mode. Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no ptp protocol
